publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3805 Carolyn Leckie: Detention of Tehran Bus Workers Union Leader—That the Parliament notes with concern the continued detention of Mansour Osanloo, leader of the Tehran bus workers union, the Sherkate Vahed syndicate, following a strike on 25 December 2005 over wages and conditions, notes that the International Confederation of Free Trade Unions has written to Mr Mahmoud Ahmadjinejad, President of the Islamic Republic of Iran, expressing great concern about the health of Mansour Osanloo and his continued detention, and calls on the Iranian authorities to release him immediately.
S2M-3805 Detention of Tehran Bus Workers Union Leader (lodged on 10 January 2006) Frances Curran*, Ms Sandra White*, Rosie Kane*, Colin Fox*
S2M-3805 Detention of Tehran Bus Workers Union Leader (lodged on 10 January 2006) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Tommy Sheridan*

S2M-3805 Carolyn Leckie: Detention of Tehran Bus Workers Union Leader—That the Parliament notes with concern the continued detention of Mansour Osanloo, leader of the Tehran bus workers union, the Sherkate Vahed syndicate, following a strike on 25 December 2005 over wages and conditions, notes that the International Confederation of Free Trade Unions has written to Mr Mahmoud Ahmadjinejad, President of the Islamic Republic of Iran, expressing great concern about the health of Mansour Osanloo and his continued detention, and calls on the Iranian authorities to release him immediately. Supported by: Frances Curran, Ms Sandra White, Rosie Kane, Colin Fox, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Tommy Sheridan
S2M-3805 Detention of Tehran Bus Workers Union Leader (lodged on 10 January 2006) Chris Ballance*
